remarks: For each nonnegative integer K there are either no edges having degree K, or all vertices have degree K in a friendship graph, unless there is a universal friend.  This corresponds to claim 2 in [Huneke] p. 2:  "... all vertices have degree k, unless there is a universal friend." (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Jan-2018.)
